Detailed Description

Abstract base class for images like GIF, JPEG, PNG etc. The default implementation of Image::Draw allows horizontal and vertical scaling of an image; the derived classes just need to implement the methods BeginScanlineDrawing, DrawScanline and EndScanlineDrawing for this.

Dependant from the size and format of the image, the drawing of the image might take several seconds. To avoid blocking a user-input like a key-press, a maximum decoder delay can be specified in OptionalConfig::GetSetting (see setting MaxDecoderDelay for details). If this delay is set to e. g. 500 milliseconds then APOXI checks each 500 milliseconds if there is a user-input in the message-queue. Hence if the drawing of a large image takes e. g. 10 seconds, this check is done 20 times during the period of the 10 seconds. If there is a user-input the drawing will be cancelled and the message ImageDrawingInterruptedMsg will be posted. If there is no user-input during a check, just the display is updated to give the user a visual response about the drawing-progress of the image.

APOXI automatically tries to buffer each decoded or scaled image to increase the drawing-performance. The available image-buffer-maximum for all decoded images can be specified by GuiEngineConfig::GetSharedImageBufferMax. Additionally a maximum may be defined for one image by GuiEngineConfig::GetImageBufferMax.

As not all compilers support RTTI but this is useful for images, they provide a RTTI-support by the method Image::IsInstanceOf. This makes it necessary that each image-class gets a unique ID. The IDs from 0 to 999 are reserved for APOXI:

ID: Class

  • 0: Image
  • 1: BmpImage
  • 2: GifImage
  • 3: JpegImage
  • 4: PngImage
  • 5: WbmpImage
  • 6: NativeImage

See also:
ImageDrawingInterruptedMsg

OptionalConfig

GuiEngineConfig

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

enum Image::ErrorCode
 

The current state of the error-code of an image can be retrieved by invoking the method GetErrorCode, which returns an INT-value as error-information. This INT-value is mapped to error-codes represented as enums in the corresponding image-classes. The value-range is divided into the following sections:

  • 0 to 20: common error-codes
  • 21 to 40: JPEG
  • 41 to 60: PNG
  • 61 to 80: GIF
  • 81 to 100: WBMP
  • 101 to 120: Native image
  • 121 to 255: error-codes for custom image classes
Enumerator:
NoError  no error has occured (should be the normal case)
UnspecifiedError  an unspecified error has occured, no specific information is available
InvalidSizeError  the image has an invalid size (e. g. the width is zero)
InitializationError  an error occured during the initialization of the drawing
ScanlineBufferError  no scanline-buffer could be obtained, which is needed for scaling
MissingDataError  the image-object does not contain any data
IsCurrentlyDecodedError  when using ConvertToBitmap the image is already decoded by a threadlet
CouldNotAllocateThreadletError  the threadlet needed for decoding in ConvertToBitmap could not be allocated
ThreadletStoppedError  a threadlets has been stopped so no drawing is performed
OutOfMemoryError  memory for the decoder could not be allocated
DecodingInterruptedError  the decoding has been interrupted by invoking Image::StopDecoding

enum Image::ValidationResult
 

Is returned by the method Image::Validate.

Enumerator:
Valid  The image is valid and Image::GetErrorCode will return ErrorCode::NoError.
Invalid  The image is invalid. The reason of the error can be retrieved by invoking Image::GetErrorCode.
InProgress  The validation is still ongoing. In this case the application must listen to the message ImageDecodingProgressMsg to check when the validation has been finished.

void Image::AdjustSize (  XYDIM &  width,
XYDIM &  height
)  const [protected]
 

Adjusts the size of the image to the given width and height.

Parameters:
width I/O parameter, which gets the wished width as input and contains the available width.
width I/O parameter, which gets the wished height as input and contains the available height.

void * Image::BeginScanlineDrawing (  INT  frame_idx = 0  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

If an image is drawn scanline by scanline, this method is invoked before drawing the first scanline. Usually this is the place where the image-decoder should be initialized (see class ImageDecoder for details) and returned as context-object. If no image-decoder is required, it is recommended to return the pointer to the instance of the image-class itself.

Parameters:
frame_idx Index of the frame, which should be drawn.
Returns:
A pointer to a context-object, which is passed as parameter when invoking DrawScanline and EndScanlineDrawing. Returning 0 means that there has been an an error and hence DrawScanline and EndScanlineDrawing may not invoked afterwards.
See also:
EndScanlineDrawing

DrawScanline

Reimplemented in BmpImage, GifImage, JpegImage, WbmpImage, and NativeImage.

BOOLEAN Image::CheckForInterrupt (   )  const [protected]
 

Returns TRUE, if the decoding has been interrupted by a user-interaction. This method should be used in combination with a CleanupDrawingObtainer.

BOOLEAN Image::ConvertToBitmap (  Bitmap *  bitmap,
INT  frame_idx = 0,
BOOLEAN  block = TRUE
) 
 

Converts the image to a bitmap. This allows very fast drawing operations, but may result in a higher memory demand, because usually most images are compressed.

Parameters:
bitmap Pointer to the bitmap, which should contain the converted image. The image is automatically scaled to the size of the bitmap.
frame_idx Index of the frame, which should be converted to a bitmap.
block If set to TRUE the converting is done synchronously, which means that the thread is blocked until the converting has been finished. This is only recommended for small images. When set to FALSE, the converting is done by the worker-thread and the message ImageDecodingProgressMsg including the progress-value is posted frequently, until the converting has been finished.
Returns:
TRUE if the converting has been successful.
See also:
Bitmap

BOOLEAN Image::DecodeSynchronously (   )  const [virtual]
 

Indicates, whether an Image should be decoded synchronously or asynchronously and being buffered by default. The default setting is TRUE.

Returns:
Returns TRUE if image should be decoded synchronously

Reimplemented in SvgImage, and NativeImage.

void Image::Draw (  DeviceContext *  dc,
XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y
)  const
 

Draws the image at position x, y using the given device-context.

BOOLEAN Image::Draw (  DeviceContext *  dc,
XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
INT  frame_idx,
XYDIM  scaled_width = -1,
XYDIM  scaled_height = -1,
const Rect &  clip_rect = Rect()
)  const [virtual]
 

Draws the frame_idxth frame of the Image at position x, y using the given device context.

Parameters:
dc Device context to draw the image.
x X-position of the image origin.
y Y-position of the image origin.
frame_idx Number of image frame which should be painted.
scaled_width Scaled width of the image. If -1 is used, the original width is taken.
scaled_height Scaled height of the image. If -1 is used, the original height is taken.
clip_rect Specifies the area inside the image which must be painted.
Returns:
TRUE, if the drawing has been successful. If FALSE is returned, the corresponding error can be retrieved by invoking the method GetErrorCode.

Reimplemented in PngImage, SvgImage, and NativeImage.

void Image::DrawCorruptImageSign (  DeviceContext *  dc,
XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
XYDIM  scaled_width,
XYDIM  scaled_height
)  const [virtual]
 

Is invoked by the decoder, if the decoding has been failed and allows to draw an image sign for corrupt images (e. g. a red cross). Per default nothing is drawn.

void Image::DrawScanline (  void *  context,
DeviceContext *  dc,
XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
INT  scanline_idx,
INT  old_scanline_idx
)  const [protected, virtual]
 

Draws the specified scanline. Must be implemented for scaling.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved in BeginScanlineDrawing.
x X-position of the image origin.
y Y-position of the image origin.
scanline_idx Number of the scanline index that should be drawn. It is assured, that the scanline_idx is always >= the old_scanline_idx. When the image is not scaled, the scanline_idx is always old_scanline_idx + 1, but it is important to recognize also the cases where the scanline_idx is equal to the old_scanline_idx (this happens when the height of an image is increased) or the scanline_idx is greater then the old_scanline_idx + 1 (this happens when the height of the image is decreased). If the decoder requires that the scanline_idx is always increased by one, the method Image::IsFullTraversingEnabled must be overwritten to return TRUE.
old_scanline_idx Number of last drawn scanline index.

Reimplemented in BmpImage, GifImage, JpegImage, WbmpImage, and NativeImage.

void Image::EndScanlineDrawing (  void *  context  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

If an image is drawn scanline by scanline, this method is invoked after drawing the last scanline. Usually the image-decoder should be freed at this place (see class ImageDecoder for details).

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved in BeginScanlineDrawing
See also:
BeginScanlineDrawing

DrawScanline

Reimplemented in BmpImage, GifImage, JpegImage, WbmpImage, and NativeImage.

const BinData * Image::GetBinData (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the binary data of the image. Per default 0 is returned.

Reimplemented in BmpImage, GifImage, JpegImage, PngImage, WbmpImage, SvgImage, NativeImage, and EmsImage.

INT8 Image::GetBitsPerPixel (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the number of bits for one pixel. If the image represents a grayscale format, the value is less than 0. F.i: A bpp value of 6 means a color image which uses 6 bits to code one pixel, a value of -6 means a grayscale image with 64 grayscales. Monchrom images have a bpp value of 1.

UINT8 Image::GetErrorCode (  void   )  const [inline]
 

Returns an error-code of the image-object. The error-code might be checked, whenever the methods Draw or ConvertToBitmap return FALSE, which indicates that an error has occured during the initialization, the decoding or drawing of the image. For each image-class the error-code is mapped to an enum including the description of the error. Example: if (image.GetErrorCode() == Image::InvalidSizeError) { ... }

INT Image::GetFrameCount (   )  const [inline]
 

Gives the number of (virtual) frames in the image. If the image is not animated, GetFrameCount returns 1.

virtual UINT32 Image::GetFrameDelay (  INT  frame_idx  )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the time in milliseconds the specified frame should be displayed. The value Image::c_unlimited means that it should be displayed _forever_.

Implemented in BmpImage, GifImage, JpegImage, PngImage, WbmpImage, SvgImage, NativeImage, and EmsImage.

Returns the number of repetations of an animation.

Returns:
Value greater that 0: Number of repeations, 0 for unlimited repetations, a value less than 0 if this Image is not animated.

XYDIM Image::GetScaledHeight (  XYDIM  scaled_width  )  const
 

Returns the scaled height corresponding to to the scaled width scaled_width keeping the same ratio.

XYDIM Image::GetScaledWidth (  XYDIM  scaled_height  )  const
 

Returns the scaled width corresponding to to the scaled height scaled_height keeping the same ratio.

XYDIM Image::GetScanlineDiff (  void *  context,
INT  scanline_idx,
INT  old_scanline_idx
)  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns the difference of the real y-position of the scanline in relation to the scanline-index. Per default 0 is returned, which means that e. g. the y-position of the scanline with the index 5 is also 5. If e. g. -2 is return for the scanline with the index 5, the real y-position would be 3. Returning a different value then 0 makes only sense for interlaced images.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved in BeginScanlineDrawing.
scanline_idx Number of scanline index that should be drawn.
old_scanline_idx Number of last drawn scanline index.

Reimplemented in BmpImage, and GifImage.

ColorValue Image::GetTransparentColor (  void *  context  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns the color-value of the transparent color. The value is only valid, if IsTransparent is TRUE. Per default 0 is returned.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved within Image::BeginScanlineDrawing.

Reimplemented in BmpImage, GifImage, PngImage, WbmpImage, SvgImage, and NativeImage.

XYDIM Image::GetWidth (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the number of pixel in horizontal dimension.

BOOLEAN Image::HasAlphaChannel (  void *  context  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the image supports alpha blending. Per default, FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved within Image::BeginScanlineDrawing.

Reimplemented in PngImage, and SvgImage.

BOOLEAN Image::IsBufferingAllowed (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the image may get buffered. Per default TRUE is returned. Usually it should be possible to buffer any kind of image, but there might be use cases like for SVG images where a buffering should be avoided.

Reimplemented in SvgImage.

BOOLEAN Image::IsCopyrighted (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE if the image is copyrighted, FALSEotherwise. Per default FALSE is returned.

Reimplemented in NativeImage.

BOOLEAN Image::IsCurrentlyDecoded (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the image is currently decoded and hence the decoding is not finished yet. This information is useful to find out, whether the decoding has been finished, if ConvertToBitmap has been invoked.

BOOLEAN Image::IsFullTraversingEnabled (  void *  context  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Per default FALSE is returned, which means that when drawing the scanlines of the image, not all of them must be traversed. This increases the performance when scaling an image, where the scaled height is smaller then the image-height. But especially for interlaced images or images with complex decoders it makes sense to force the traversing of all scanlines, as it allows a more efficient implementation of the decoder.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved within Image::BeginScanlineDrawing

Reimplemented in BmpImage, and GifImage.

BOOLEAN Image::IsInstanceOf (  INT  id  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the image is an instance of the image-class with the ID id. Must be implemented by each derived class the following way: 

BOOLEAN MyImage::IsInstanceOf(INT id) const
{
    if (ID != id)
        return Base::IsInstanceOf(id);
    return TRUE;
}

Example: if it should be checked, whether an item is an instance of the class JpegImage the following code might be used: 

if (img->IsInstanceOf(JpegImage::ID)) {
    JpegImage* jpeg_img = (JpegImage*)img;
    ...
}

The IDs from 0 to 99 are reserved for APOXI.

Reimplemented in BmpImage, GifImage, JpegImage, PngImage, WbmpImage, SvgImage, and NativeImage.

BOOLEAN Image::IsPreviousFrameBuffering (   )  const [inline, protected]
 

Returns TRUE if the buffer from the previous frame should be used for drawing the current frame

BOOLEAN Image::IsProgressMsgEnabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Check, if sending progress messages is enabled or disabled.

BOOLEAN Image::IsTransparent (  void *  context  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the image has transparent pixels. Having transparent pixels may slow down the displaying-process of an image. Per default FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved in BeginScanlineDrawing.

Reimplemented in GifImage, PngImage, WbmpImage, SvgImage, and NativeImage.

void Image::ObtainBackgroundImages (   )  [inline]
 

Per default background images which are passed to the image by Image::SetBackgroundImage are not owned by the image and hence may not get deleted before the image gets deleted. If the caller allocated the background images and does not delete the image object itself, he can forward the ownership to the image object by invoking Image::ObtainBackgroundImages. This means that when the image is deleted all background images will get deleted too.

void Image::SetBackgroundImage (  Bitmap *  background,
INT  frame_idx = 0
) 
 

Sets the background image that is needed for animation buffering when having transparent images. The background image is not owned by the image object per default, hence it may not be deleted before the image object is deleted. The ownership can be passed to the image by invoking Image::ObtainBackgroundImages.

See also:
Image::ObtainBackgroundImages

void Image::SetBitsPerPixel (  INT8  bpp  )  [inline, protected]
 

Wrapper method for setting the bits per pixel of the image meta data.

void Image::SetErrorCode (  UINT8  error_code  )  const
 

Sets the state of the error-code of an image. This state should be set, whenever an error occurs when initializing, decoding or drawing an image. If the error code is not Image::ErrorCode::NoError then additionally an ImageDecodingProgressMsg is broadcasted with the value -1 as progress information. This indicates that that the dispatcher which listens to this message should check the error code of the image.

void Image::SetFrameCount (  INT  frame_count  )  [protected]
 

Wrapper method for setting the frame count of the image meta data.

void Image::SetHeight (  XYDIM  height  )  [inline, protected]

Sets the meta data for the image, which describes basic data like width and height.

void Image::SetPreviousFrameBuffering (  BOOLEAN  previous  )  const [inline, protected]
 

Sets the drawing mode of current image. If set to TRUE then the previous frame should be used as basis for drawing the current frame. Currently only used within GIF images when the frame is a diff to the previous frame. Normally set to TRUE

void Image::SetProgressMsgEnabled (  BOOLEAN  progress  )  [inline]
 

Allows to disable sending progress messages.

void Image::StopDecoding (   )  const
 

Stops the decoding of an image.

See also:
IsCurrentlyDecoded

Image::ValidationResult Image::Validate (  INT  frame_idx = 0,
BOOLEAN  block = TRUE
) 
 

Checks whether the the image data is valid. Note that this is a very expensive operation as the whole image data must be decoded.

Parameters:
frame_idx Index of the frame, which should be validated.
block If set to TRUE the decoding is done synchronously and hence the calling application is blocked until the decoding has been finished. This is only acceptable for small images. When checking the validity of large images block should be set to FALSE. In this case the decoding is done in a separate thread and the message ImageDecodingProgressMsg is send periodically. This message can be treated by the application to show e. g. a progress bar during decoding (sample code is available in the GUI Tutorial).
Returns:
In the blocking mode either Valid is returned or Invalid. If Invalid is returned the reason of the error can be checked by invoking Image::GetErrorCode. In the non blocking mode InProgress is returned. In this case the application must listen to the message ImageDecodingProgressMsg to check when the validation has been finished. The error code must be checked when the ImageDecodingProgressMsg returns -1 as progress.

void Image::WaitUntilDecodingIsFinished (   )  const [inline]
 

Obsolete - does the same as Image::StopDecoding. Waiting until the decoding is finished would mean blocking a high priority thread until the low priority thread finished, which is conceptionally flawed.
